38887797.review: This game is great. It's actually quite playable, even in beta. The new player experience is well-based, and the VR interaction is quite natrual.

38877168.review: its a pretty unforgiving game and it *will* take you a couple of deaths to fully learn the ropes of thise game, but ultimately its an awesome experience especially for lovers of the resource management (rust or ark) style survival games

38859415.review:
Questo gioco di base è davvero valido.
essere sperduti nello spazio e dover trovare i materiali nei relitti adiacenti è una bella trovata ma con oculus cv1 ho un problema poichè spesso e volentieri vedo tutto grigio per qualche secondo finchè poi ricomincio a vedere. 
nei momenti di relax ( molto rari ) ci sta, ma quando stai morendo senza ossigeno e devi aprire al più presto la navicella inizia a diventare parecchio irritante.
spero venga sistemato perchè con gli altri giochi non mi capita praticamente mai.

38768061.review: Fun survival game for VR. Locomotion is great! JUst wish their was some options to make the game seem less like you always have to be rushing.

38680877.review:
Game is a cluster fuck.  It's basically impossible to build a sustainable base within one life and it seems to be by design.  Only by eating death after death can you actually progress to the point that you have a base you can replenish your supplies in.  Until then, you have to replenish supplies while outside of your base.

Also asteroid storms happen without warning and you WILL get hit many times before you can get into cover and stop taking damage.  

Still, the visuals are pretty and the gameplay is interesting.

38647273.review: Only spent an hour on it so far. Already super impressed (for VR). Already worth the money

38560842.review:
Imagine the movie, Gravity, but in deep space, and you're the sole survivor, and you hav a good idea of how the game starts.  Now imagine that the ship you were on had all the items you need to survive, and it's up to you to float around (using your suit oxygen as propellent) and you'll have a good idea of what you'll be doing.  

There are a couple of bugs, I think, that I've found (like I suffocate when I still have air (wtf?)) but as soon as you learn to store EVERYTHING of value in your shelter inventory, dying and respawning will not be as bad as it is in most survival games.  The bugs are not game-breaking in my opinion.

It's nice to see a proper survival game in VR not be about zombies or supernatural events.  The gun they give you, so far as I can tell, is for destroying incoming meteroids and LASER turrets, not aliens.  That's nice.

38552616.review: If you are thinking of the horrible experience that Adrift was then read this. This game is made for VR. The method of moving is either by grabbing your surrounding objects and pulling yourself then you can also move around using thrusters mounted to your hands.

38545365.review:
This is the best VR Sci-Fi game I have had the pleasure of playing. The Physics are solid, the graphics are crisp, and the controls are tight. 

The Devs are extremely active and interactive. They take suggestions seriously and have implemented many from weapon modifications to 6 DOF movement. Join the Discord and opt into the Test Branch you will not be disappointed.

Best of all it has the thumbs up from Dreamphile Studios™ so you know it’s got something great going on about it.

"10/10"  "★★★★★"

38497126.review:
Must admit, initially refunded this game after a few minutes of play. But can wholeheartedly recommend it now after playing for a few more hours.

Yes. It's early access. Yes, there are still a few bugs. But unlike with most early access games I played the creators are incredibly active, they communicate with their playerbase directly, and fix things with incredible speed. (If you're curious about this game but wondering if it's properly supported, hop on to the discord and find out.)

Pros: 
- The feeling of pushing yourself away from your little ship and floating through space only to grab onto that piece of spacejunk you were aiming for by the tip of your fingers is awesome.
- Very involved devs, bugreports get handled at an incredible speed. 
- Information ingame is presented in a very clear and intuitive way.
- Controls take some getting used to, but once you have them under control it feels natural.
- The harshness of the survival aspect of the game makes you feel an incredible sense of achievement once you managed to build that *insert item here* you've been wanting.
- Available ships to explore still feel new and exciting after 8 hours of play, finding the biodome ship and... well.. spoilers.
- There's a poll up right now for the direction the game should take. Awesome options available. 
- Great balance between what you retain after death, and what you lose.

Mixed:
- Survival can be a bit harsh, having just salvaged an entire derelict ship and floating back to your own little capsule only to notice your oxygen is on 2%... either pray you've aimed correctly or use thrusters to maneuvre while you're still able to... suffocate or miss your target... Then again, that's part of the charm. 

Cons: 
- No definite roadmap for the game (that I could find). As developers there's always a battle between using community input for the game development, or sticking to your own ideas. For now the devs use community input it seems, which can be a good thing, but doesn't give us an idea what to expect.
- Not much to do yet other than surviving. The core survival mechanics are in game, and a hell of a lot of fun, but an objective seems to be missing, it's being worked on from what I've heard though.
- Player body looks... off... Your arms reach to the floor, it makes your feel like an orangatan.
- Some bugs as mentioned. Latest update should have fixed the ones that were gamebreaking for me though. 

All in all, for an early access game: 9/10, would suffocate climbing into my ship airlock again.

38444244.review:
Early Access Review!!

Pros: 

Floating through space on intercept trajectories with space junk using only your handheld boosters (and your gun if your desperate) to guide you... dont miss your target...

A survival game that is a real challenge 
-You have to grow food, in order to grow food you have to source the materials and seeds from the space junk.
-Oxygen and electricity are a commodity, use them wisely.
- Defend you ship from the ever present threat of asteroids that can punch holes in your ship and suck out all your precious O2.

Standing, Sitting, or room space compatable. you'll be flailing your arms around to jockey around satelites to avoid asteroid showers so bring your motivation.

Cons: 
Basic graphical design.
The tutorial doesn't explain much.
No music/ over tone sounds
Dieing is frustrating, but your progress on the ship is saved

Conclusion:

No it doesn't have great graphics or a formidable musical score. But the concept is great and very original. If you want something that stands out from the masses of shooters for VR this is the game for you. Coming from a one man studio this is great stuff and he is constantly updating and asking the community for feedback I see this going far and getting more polished along the way.

38431884.review:
Even though the game is at its infancy, it can already provide lots of entertainment. It feels exactly like you would expect it to feel, i.e. calming and cool. The zero g aspects and locomotion of this game are spot on, with the exception of the home station having friction in movement for extra comfort when navigating the menu in the middle of the base.

The game's rough around the edges, but there are no game breaking bugs, and if there are, they get patched out very quickly. There is lots of potential for the game as well, and considering the previous products of Overflow, they can be trusted in terms of meeting it.

You can see from the trailer that the game relies on text-to-speech elements, which might make the game feel low quality, but you eventually stop noticing it.

The game itself is difficult, but not in a bad way. Currently, Newbies might die a dozen times on their first playthrough, be it from poor resource management or enemies.

38370965.review:
I want to really like the game but for me it still isn't clicking just yet. I think it has potential and the premise is interesting. I like the challenge of managing your momentum and sometimes the oxygen canister is just out of reach as I zoom by which makes for some fun and intense moments. 

For the love of the gooey space gods, please reduce the rate at which the meteor showers occur. (Or let this be player adjustable) I like the gameplay element of them (find and duck behind some space trash) but right now they are spawning every 15 to 20 seconds and it is ruining the fun of the game for me. Also, thank you for allowing control customizations for the oculus touch. Sometimes the grip mechanic is a bit buggy, and I find I clip through objects sometimes. 

I know it is early access, and I look forward to this game getting better, and jumping back into it at a later time.

38247082.review: Great game for early access, already a lot of fun and can see it getting a lot better.

38242474.review: Frustrierend und Genial zugleich =) Sehr schwer aber wenn mans erstmal raus hat bockts richtig, kanns nur empfehlen =)

38155813.review: This game is incredibly hard, I still have not made the first plant pot, maybe I am just really unlucky.

37901492.review: Extremely active Devs and an amazing game to boot. I really look forward to seeing the future features that the Devs have planned for this game.

37747720.review:
いまのところクリア要素は未実装で、ひたすら船の周辺を探索して資源を集め、船を強化しまくるだけのゲームです。
が、それだけでもなかなか面白く、気付けば数時間は軽く遊んでしまいます。

基本は船の周辺を探索して、壊れた人工衛星、各種宇宙船、施設を調査して資源を集め、
集めた資源を使用して自分の船、スーツを強化してゆきます。

クリアに必要だと思われる核融合炉はまだ存在しません。

ちなみに、船の強化状況は死んでも維持されます。
資源系は消失するので、積極的に船の強化に回すとよいでしょう。

スーツ、銃の強化状況は死ぬと初期化されます。
ただし船内でResarch Pointを使用して強化する「銃の装弾数」「スーツの対放射線性能」などは維持されます。

最初は酸素、電力、食料の確保が大変で、大抵は窒息死です。
その次は餓死でしょう。

そこから素材を集めてPlant Potをクラフトし、草を植えて酸素と食料を作れるようにし、
Solar Panelをクラフトして発電できるようにできてからはだいぶ安定します。

並行してタレット等を設置して、度々飛来する隕石を自動的に迎撃するようにしましょう。

船で酸素、電力、食料の補充ができるようになれば、次は大型の残骸の調査です。
ランダムな位置に生成される小型、中型の船、輸送船、謎の施設などを調査して更に資源を集め、どんどん船を強化します。

ちなみにこれらは自分の船の天井付近にあるシートに座り、「Sleep」することで再配置される？ ようです。
ひととおり探索したら「Sleep」して再び探索しましょう。

いまのところこれだけのようですが、微妙に形の変化する船、施設を探索するのはなかなか楽しいです。

何より、広大な宇宙空間を孤独に漂う感じが素晴らしい。
船のレバーを手で操作し、扉を開いて宇宙に身体を放り出す感覚は独特です。

グラフィックはローポリ気味ですが、グラフィックが悪いというよりは「そういうテイスト」で、
そのおかげか負荷も軽く、快適に遊べています。

ローポリなりに船は複雑なデザインをしていますし、太陽は綺麗です。

また、天地が逆転するようなこともないため、個人差はあるでしょうが、酔いはありません。

まだまだこれからのようですが、現時点で数時間没頭して遊べるゲームなので、なかなかオススメできます。

37273590.review: Game is fun so far and heading in the right direction

37191809.review:
Probably my favorite VR game at the moment. Chill game in space while you float from debris to debris gathering stuff to upgrade your base. I love the grabbing stuff to move around locomotion. Definitely recommend getting this at any price.

It runs great on SS 2.0 on a 970, encountered just 1 minor bug so far, died a lot of times and it was fun. At the moment the game is updated often and it's shaping up to be a great game.

36966242.review:
This is, quite frankly, one of the most enjoyable, and yet frustrating VR games that I have played to date.

The Good.
A fun and clean visual style.
Easy and fun movement system with options to adjust it.
Well put together sounds.
A wonderful menu/inventory system that makes you interact with parts of yourself, rather than just button presses.
An RNG scavenging system that can make you.

The Bad.
An Rng scavenging system that can break you.
The hazards seem to have a random allotment. In my first game after the first twenty minutes, there were about 15 drones hovering outside my ship... I could go nowhere. The second game, 30 minutes in, and I had seen exatly 3 drones... The I blew up my ship with a rocket mod and felt the need to restart.
Third game by 30 minutes in, at any given moment, there were at least two meteorites headed for my ship... When I got a notice and looked, and saw 8... EIGHT meteorites headed for my ship... most of them headed for the solar panels I had up... Well... you see where this is going.
The Physics can be a bit wonky at times.

The Ugly.
Can be very hard to get started, since you won't know what kind of start you have until you've already invested a fair amount of time into it.
When you die, you lose any materials, mods and upgrades you made to your suit, which makes sense, But it hurts... it hurts so good.



Final Words.

The look and feel match perfectly, and there were moments when I truly forgot myself.
Now, this is going to sound horrible, but at one point, I found myself staring at a piece of fruit, waiting for it to grow because I had just found the seed, and my hunger was at 6 points, with 68 health... And I was holding a dialogue with myself about whether this would save me, or if this character would be happy enough that the next iteration would be better off.
I died by the way.
One of the niftier features is the fact that when your character dies, It's not cloned, or revived, instead you are now a new name and age... which is purely cosmetic, and yet I found myself playing differently for each iteration based on the personality I assigned to the name.

If you are having a hard time finding what you need on the debris around you, head to home base, fly up to the pod on top and hit the sleep button, this resets the randomness of the debris fields, and spawns new major discoveries.

36903950.review: For an early access game, this one blows me away.  I love the feeling of floating through space or jetpacking through a spacestation.  I always run out of oxygen too quickly!  :D

36641677.review:
I LOVE this game. With the latest update that slows your oxygen loss, the game has achieved a wonderful balance. It's not too easy, but also not punishingly hard either. When I first bought this game, I died something like 10 times in the first 2 hours of play. Not enough oxygen, impossible to find seeds for planting both oxygen and nutrition plants, no energy canisters to be found... needless to say it was VERY difficult (for me). However, with the latest update, things are wonderful! I get a strong sense of accomplishment, and a craving to revist the world. The oxygen levels are more balanced, and you can progress at a fair pace. I'm a big fan of Conductor, and I'm really excited to see where this game goes! 

*EDITED*

I originally posted that there was a glitch with the arm quit button not working and ruining saves. Within a day of posting it, the devs had responded, created a hotfix, and patched it. Amazing devs! Get this game!

36632909.review: I love the game, but could you fix the bug where every other time the hand quit option doesn't work?  Also is there any other way to save the game than using the hand quit because when I exit using the steam page it doesn't save.

36628372.review:
This is my first review for a game on steam and it's well deserved.

Now I have encountered a few bugs here and there with the storage system or just some in-game things, but still the amount of work and effort I can see went into this game is amazing. It's by far the first VR game I have been able to play for hours straight.

If you are worrying about the motion sickness factor of being in Zero G; don't. I can barely do anything in real life that involves motion sickness and trust me VR is the same with it, but this game after the first few minutes of getting the feel for it, aslong as you have a good FPS which I do except for inside my ship facing certain ways which I assume is part of the game being so fresh they have to work on parts to fix issues like that, but there is no instance where I got motion sick. It may be different for you but the whole point is don't worry.

I do appreciate the ability of when you die, which happens a lot in the beginning unless your quick and know what your doing, that the ship and anything in it's inventory stays next to it for you to continue on your work. I like the feel of a VR Subnatica in a sense. If there was an ability to modify the exterior of the ship and maybe add on to it in the future this game would have some even more serious attention.

The developers seem to be constantly at work and interacting with the community and the to be fair, the price is exactly what any VR game should be especially for Early Access. There is not a single thing I dislike besides a few bugs with the GUI when I try to quit and for some reason it won't let me so I have to force leave from the Desktop and lose a load of progress, so don't go button smashing around in the menu's is my advice.

In one line to sum this game up.
The developers make Unity seem like a AAA game engine.

36567975.review:
Though YoreVR would be the first game to capitalize on the booming game genre that is survival crafting open world popularized by Minecraft (Which also has a VR version btw), I feel like Star Shelter captures the genre more in terms of adapting survival with dynamic environmental systems giving the VR space you are playing in more alive than I have ever felt with other open ended VR games. Here are the reasons why:

1 - Except your ship, everything else is procedural. Why is this so good in VR? 

Because being immersed into an environment not even the Devs can predict is when the gaming world you play in has a life of its own. That is so close to actual reality the only parts missing are full wireless and all senses capture which is a console creator's job and not the dev.

2 - Unlike other VR survivals, you actually have to grind it out just to be able to survive. That means you have an objective at the beginning. which makes getting comfortability up and expansion a quest worth taking so that you can survive better. Being able to at least reach minimum no death stability by adding components to your base and hopefully expanding it soon feels so rewarding and fun because you can to feel its progress where you altogether stop dying and then being able to explore further (where no man has gone before or probably did but died anyway)

3 - Undefined borders of map area. To some, this may be too uncomfortable, prefering to have a guide or tutorial in clear instructions to explore with ease and security. However this I believe is the secret that made Minecraft the grand daddy foundation of the entire survival genre. I hope they make it endlessly procedural and add multiplayer, then you put a dlc or even sell it after as Star Shelter 2 once its endless with some large floating platforms that can be built upon and multiplayer. Now this would make this game feel exactly like Star Trek says, "To boldly go where no man has gone before," even if its digital space, that unique coding with a set parameter encompassing an unpredictability that is you and your friends holds true as a fact.

4 - Best locomotion used. I would say Lone Echo came up with the coding first but who knows, all I can say is that this type of zero-G locomotion was something I thought of the moment I saw Detached intros and within months, two games already have this thought that became a dream and is now a reality.

5 - Didn't notice that much bugs on Oculus and even if some sensor screw up happens, the game is forgiving if you are used to survival games and know how to prep yourself. 

TIPS: Dont do anything except scavenge for plant pot parts and you will find an oxygen plant seed or two with other plant seeds. One is enough to allow you to survive indefinitely without suffocating for oxygen, and two will allow for some canisters to be packed with you or explore comfortably. Then focus on more plant pots for other seeds for nutrition. These two will allow you to finally be immortal without dying constantly from suffocation or starvation. Once you reach this immortal stage, you can then focus on upgrading your suit for better survivability whilst exploring further into the depths of space. Dealing with comets and drones can be annoying but remember you dont lose stuff you keep in the ship or have built. Once you have upgraded your suit, then it is important to deal with them. Comets dont give anything but drones do. Ignoring them means passing up on their valuable parts.

Cons:
- Its EA
- Deal with it
- Keep Calm and VR
- Keep watching for updates

36509029.review: Probably one of the best "survival" type games on VR right now. Constant updates, great developers!

36461433.review:
・概要
宇宙基地が事故で爆発し（たぶん）、一人大小のデブリ漂う宇宙空間に投げ出された主人公。小さな宇宙ポッドを拠点に、デブリから素材を回収し、ポッドや宇宙服を強化して過酷な宇宙で生き延びろ！というゲームです。

・ゲームプレイ
手すりや壁をつかんで移動し、浮かぶオブジェクトに手を伸ばしてとるといった、VRのモーション操作と高い没入感は宇宙空間と相性が良く、移動や回収作業自体のアクション性が楽しいです。探索箇所も、通信衛星のような小さなものだけでなく、居住施設やバイオプラントのような大きなデブリもあり、ワクワクします。必要なクラフトは多く、故障を直したり接近する隕石を撃ち落としたり中々忙しい。UIや操作は直感的で分かりやすいです。

最初は勝手がわからず良く死ぬと思います。死ぬと集めた素材はなくなってしまいますが、クラフトして強化した部分は（一部除いて）残るので、ノウハウもたまってだんだん長く生きられるようになります。それでも油断すると死んでしまう適度な緊張感があります。

6時間ほどのプレイでクラフトはまだまだ、ただ探索箇所は8割方見てしまったかなというところ。EAなので今後の実装が楽しみです。今のところ継続的にアプデされ、実装してほしいアプデ要素の投票受付なんかもやってます。

・酔い
無重力空間ではありますが、横(ロール)回転・縦(ピッチ)回転はせず、酔いにくいです。LoneEcho(EchoArena)と同じ仕様ですね。

・英語
簡単な指示や単語が読めればOK、聞き取り不要。

・欠点
ストーリー展開や場面演出はほぼ無し。雰囲気は良く出ていますが、グラフィックは最低限。オブジェクトが掴める位置なのに掴めなかったり、あたり判定にイラっとする場面も。

36386111.review:
Though it's still early days for VR, I keep wondering what will be the first game that will soak up hundreds of hours for me - not just a shallow five-minute or hour-long experience, but a real game that keeps you coming back for more. I haven't played that much of Star Shelter yet, but what I've seen is deeply impressive and hints at the possibility of something really deep and addictive.

Star Shelter reminds me of other space survival games like Space Engineers or Starmade, and in that regard it's not really reinventing the genre or anything. But this is, of course, in VR - and what an amazing difference that makes. The movement mechanic is very intuitive and very fun - like a real astronaut, you grab handles and bars to fling yourself around, and there will be plenty of [i]Gravity[/i]-style situations where you reach out to grab a passing satellite just in time before floating into deep space. You do have thrusters if you miss - but in a clever mechanic, using the thrusters depletes your oxygen supply. So there's a constant challenge of exploring as much as you can without suffocating on the way.

There are some annoyances - picking up resources feels clunkier than it should be, and I'm still not really clear on how you replenish your oxygen supply without being lucky enough to find a spare tank floating around. But that's all early access stuff and there's plenty of fun for the money even at this stage.

That sense of wonder that VR promises is fulfilled in Star Shelter - coming across a derelict spaceship, hacking the airlock open, and pulling yourself inside to find the eerie abandoned bunks and silent cockpits of the dead craft. Clinging on to your space station with one hand while lining up a shot on a rogue comet with the other. The palpable sense of relief when you enter an oxygen pocket and raise your hand to your helmet to open the visor. It's a really strong start and I'm excited to see what comes next.

36311265.review: Awesome! Not only is the movement very comfortable but the controls and feel of the game overall are really good. You are stranded in space and have to use thrusters to get around to salvage space junk to patch up your ship. It's pretty difficult and not everything is very clear yet but I can't wait to play more and try to figure out how to survice. Highly recommended!

36301917.review:
An early game, but it's got good potential and it's relatively fun as is. Needs a bit more story and a few extra mechanics to make is consistent and give the player more drive to actually do things other than "just because". But it's got good potential and the base mechanics are more fun tham the other earlier space survival VR game, I would though like more in depth mechanics like it had with the ability to pull of panels and fix or salvage parts. 

Another locomotion option might be good as well, some kind of tether or grabber gun might be good.

It's going for a very subnautica in space kind of feel, and if you were comparing to subnautica it compares favourably to the very early builds of the game where there wasn't much to do other than gather and build.

Played for a bit and decided to keep it, will check in as it develops and updates.

36298325.review:

It may seem daunting at first and to be honest first plays can be real hard and seem unfair, but as with any survival games you get the hang of it. You learn to prioritise things, expand and craft things that increase your chance of survival. Stick with it and you will see for yourself.

Currently working on a series on Youtube, check it out

36269762.review: really good from what i've played so far, feels kinda like subnautica in space.

Very fun survival/crafting/base building game.

Full recommendation

35930489.review: I've been looking for a fun survival game to play for a long time in vr. I must say after playing this game for a little while i have instantly fallen in love with it. There are so many things you have to worry about to survive and it makes it great. Rushing back to your ship on low oxygen and hoping to be able get the materials you need give this game a  feeling or both pressure and relief if successful. I highly reccomend this game for anyone looking for a survival style game. I would like to ask if the developers were thinking of adding maybe a 2 play co-op or something of that sort my friend and i would love to play together. Also great job devs i look forward to seeing what improvements you make to this game.

35927923.review: I am really impressed by Star shelter. The gameloop and mechanics are all there. The movement mechanic in zero-g works really great in VR. It just needs some more polish and refinement. Very responsive dev and i am really looking forwards to see what this becomes in a couple of month. Recommended !

Ich muss sagen, ich finde das Spiel recht schwierig. Technisch ist gar nicht sooo viel dran auszusetzen, es sieht optisch ganz nett aus, spielt sich gut (Steuerung und so) und ist eigentlich genau was ich mag: Survival.

35831012.review:
At the moment, this is Early Access and things are bound to change.
I've already dropped more than 5 hours into this despite some obvious and major bugs. It's damn fun and it sounds like the developer is really on-top of updates and listening to their audience so I'm very excited to see where this goes. It's got a good framework, I just hope it fills out well. At a $15 price-tag it's cheaper than going to a big movie-theater and much longer lasting entertainment.

I recommend checking this out.
If you don't know if you should buy it or not, at least put it on your wishlist and/or follow the updates, it's got great potential.

35807638.review:
Star Shelter is a very solid survival game where even after you have your stuff together you can still die due to your own mistakes (unlike many survival games that become way too easy after you have an established base). You play as a survivor of a large ship explosion that you escaped in a pod. Upon your death, another survivor in an escape pod comes across your small spaceship and you pick up where you left off, minus any character upgrades and supplies.

Overall a very solid base game, with experienced VR devs that are very active. Much more to come, prsumably but already a very good survival game.

35787560.review: *Changed my review because Dev was fast to respond and work to fix things. Still, make sure you are running the game as administrator before you start. Fun game already with a lot of potential!

35784743.review:
Caught in outerspaces bermuda triangle the spaceship grinder, you have to leave ship in a space evacuation pod. your in space with a suit to your name and a small habital station that it vaccant of anything useful(alittle o2 n power), you see debris, satellites, space stations and ships with differing levels of damage, every breath is less o2(oxygen) you got in your suit... your mission survive (travel, scavange, craft, stay alive)....

Thats the essense i get from this game "so far". Its a space survival scavanging crafting game with some base building and protecting that currently does little hand holding, i like it that way... 

you got 4 bars=> o2, health, hunger, power. If you run out of o2 you start to suffocate and take damage on health untill you get o2 "better be soon" or die. i believe hunger works the same iv yet to starve got close thou. power is used by gun, when scavanging and crafting.            Every now and again an astreriod is on a crash course with your little station your using as a base, either repair or shoot it down and hostile drones come to attack you sometimes. thrusters use the o2 in your suit "is awesome" gun has recoil can send you flying.

Its Early Access but is already alot of fun and has a great *ambiance* [was going to put atmosphere but no were in outer space lol] there can be urgancy to your thoughts even if your leisurely gliding threw 0 gravity, "i need O2, power, plants, these resouces, food... look spot launch and maybe pray "hope" it has what you need. 

The developers have a great track recorded and i hope this will evolve threw EA and become even harder with Some FTL mix with Subnautica like vibes but im already very happy with my purchase with only a little over 2 hours in.

35775753.review:
A little frustrating at first...but then it sort of grew on me. I didn't play for long, but I think this is going to be a regular go-to when I am sick of just blowing shit up in VR. it takes a bit more patience, and a little more grit to feel accomplished. I dig it. I think this will be a great one. 

I sort of wish the visuals were a little fancier though. The simplistic look isn't really for me. Everything feels a little too flat. Maybe more dynamic lighting or something. Doesn't detract too much. It is just when you actually sit and soak in the environment it is a little underhwleming.

35733250.review: When I saw how small the size of the game being downloaded, I did not think it was going to be good at all. After around 1 1/2 hours of playing, I am surprisingly impressed. 35731124.review: Game is cool, having a hard time progressing, every time I spawn there seems to be a cluster of 3 drones waiting for me. I have found ships spawning in other ships, kinda annoying. The gun is hard to shoot, or I might just suck with it. I love the movement, it is awesome. Your ship is cool, would like to be able to make it bigger, maybe even into a space station. Even if it is just prebuilt snap ons such as "living quarters" "kitchen" "airlock." Besides expansion, I would like to see a greater goal than "protect your ship from lame astroroids" This game has great potential if it included multiplayer I could see it being one of the most played vr titles out. 35706380.review:
A fun survival game. The Zero-G is well implemented, however, note that you are always verticle. This probably a design decision for orientation purposes and doesn't take a lot away from the gameplay. For Early Access, it has a good level of content and interactibility, moreso than most complete titles.  
  
The tutorial does a great job explaining the basic mechanics, but you are predominatly on your own once the game begins. There are some tooltips and text blocks that give you enough information to figure things out.   
  
I do think there is a scaling problem. Conserving your resources and trying to scavange items can be rough in the early game. I died a few times before it became somewhat manageable, then hazards increase and make it difficult to manage again. Maybe it's an experience issue, but at a rather early part of the game it makes things frustrating losing your inventory.  
  
Overall, it's fun and I look forward to future developments.

35702168.review: Its fun and you lose time in it, alot of dying but thats also fun. You dont lose everything you have built when you die, only things you have on you. The controls are kinda annoying and you sort of wrestle them abit. They have a counter until the next update, kinda like they did it in The Forest so hopefully they will add more. Alot of stuff to explore and the mission is to repair your space shuttle, and there is some enemies and metors that you have worry about. The game has a puzzle element to it and it really makes you wonder more about what happend

35699697.review: Okay I've only played about 20 minutes but this is already the most immersive VR game I've ever played. Finally a survival/crafting/persistent VR game. Thank you devs. I'll update my review once I've played more. Seriously try this one out though. It's a great price too.

35695426.review: This is a must-have for your VR gaming library! Great game concept and a lot of fun to play. The developers are awesome and very responsive in the forums (usually reply to you within minutes)). Almost daily patches and updates. Great job guys! This one is a winner!

35684197.review: This is what VR is about!  There are a few quality of life aspects I'd fix (magboots?) and oxygen is annoyingly hard to come by at first, but overall, 11/10, would WHOOP WHOOP and suffocate with my visor open in space again!

35680607.review:
Early Access:
Fun Zero-G survival, control similar to Lone Echo/Echo Arena. Barebones tutorial, may take a bit to figure out what's going on. Once you know what to do, it's pretty easy to explore and find materials. Mechanics may need some tweaking but very satisfying to survive out in space.

35666955.review:
I was really looking forward to this game after realizing it was done by the same devs who made Conductor. It's pretty sweet! Not perfect, but I think it will get there. The simpilest way I can describe it is that it's sort of like Subnautica in space. There is gun combat and lots of crafting. You find material by salvaging items that float around in space and by searching abandoned ships.

Ran into no bugginess, everything worked great. The only thing that bothered me was that the tutorial ends a little too soon, and you're left figuring out stuff on your own. And there is a bit of a learning curve. For example, it didn't teach me how to find the objects I just crafted and how to place them in my ship. 

Still pretty impressive for its first early access release. It will only get better from here on out. 

Gameplay vid if anyone cares --> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LwKcLbdA9do

35665496.review:
See the full video review here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=e8WWNzONuPk

As a disclaimer, this review is based on the prerelease version. 
Certain things may have changed after release.

Star Shelter is a built for VR Survival game for the HTC Vive and Oculus Rift by Overflow. They're the same developers behind Abode and Conductor. It's along the same lines as Subnautica or Don't Starve in that you have to explore, find resources and craft items to survive.

This game does not hold your hand. As is common in survival games, you're left to figure out a lot of things yourself. More guidance has appeared since the first time I played, so this may become easier as the development goes on.

You have stats for oxygen, power, hunger and health. Running out of power isn't much of an issue as it just inconveniences your collection of resources, but 
if your oxygen or hungry drops to 0, your health will drop and you'll soon die.

You move about by either using thrusters or grabbing surfaces to manuvuer yourself about. You can also propel yourself with the gun in a pinch. The thrusters use oxygen so you have to be careful not to overuse them.

You'll spend your time exploring space and collecting resources. You can use those to repair and upgrade various things in your ship, as well as other things.

Your ship will often take damage that needs patching up and you can create upgrades from simple ones like plant pots to grow food and plants to create oxygen to shield generators to protect the ship. 
You can also upgrade your suit.

Graphically the game is good, particularly for something made by two people.

I do have to say, and again with the disclaimer that I've been playing the pre-release version, even before Early Access, that I have come across a few bugs. Luckily it's mostly been minor things, graphical issues and the like. A couple have already been fixed since reporting them. 

The only major one is an issue some people are experiencing with the game not creating a save file.
The devs are aware. Until it is fixed, they recommend setting the executable to run as administrator if you experience this.

Star Shelter is a really fun survival game. It gives that feeling of wanting to keep going and do better next time. It's reasonably priced and worth picking up even as it is now, but it should improve even more as development goes on.

It's quickly made it's way to one of my personal top VR games, in spite of the issues I've encountered.

39349058.review:
This game is very immersive, and it has a lot of potential. Grabbing things can be a little off sometimes, but most of the time it works well and it's a lot of fun using surfaces to propel yourself. Exploring and scavenging are fun. Right now however I find the survival mechanics are incredibly harsh, it's impossible to survive more than 15 minutes. I just can't find enough oxygen cannisters to stay alive longer than that, and only found food once in a replicator. Even if I do nothing but try and find oxygen, I don't have enough time to keep it topped up. Furthermore, exploring some places is impossible due to radiation or turrets that are defending them. Even if you do find a place you can loot, the grabbing mechanics that work so well elsewhere becomes a real problem when you're trying to get things out of a box. It's very hard, sometimes impossible, to grab an object out of the box. Instead it has you grab the box as if you wanted to use it as a surface to move. I died once because I couldn't get an oxygen cannister out of a box fast enough. I haven't even survived long enough to do anything with the main ship.

All that said, while it's a little frustrating dying every 10-15 minutes and starting over as your oxygen drains extremely fast, it's one of the better VR games I've played, certainly the best space one.

39347830.review: Is it just my computer ore if this game super glitchy? Really intressting game. Would love to se some futures like the more you move, the more oxygen you use. And the sound of heart beats when its high consumption. Maybe a multiplayer would be nice to. Keep up the good work.

The tutorial stalled on me when I picked up an item, then dropped it and it disappeared and bugged the game.   I think more work needs to be done on the locomotion system... there should be some feeling or sense of mass even in zero G, being able to whip yourself around doesn't seem right.  I'll revisit this game later to see if they work the kinks out and evaluate my rating.   I think the title has promise, it's just not there right now as a pay game.

39119513.review: Jedna z najlepszych gier w jakie kiedykolwiek grałem, w dodatku gra jest nadal ulepszana i to w dobrym kierunku, dobra robota Overflow. Warta swojej ceny.

39057669.review: Still a lot of things that could be improved, but still one of the most enjoyable vr games out there.

39050396.review:
This game was a suprise!  It gives a very good first impression, with the polish of the visuals, the atmospheric sound, and the great zero gravity locomotion.  You really get a sense of being stranded out in space with little hope.   At this point, I almost feel like it might be a little TOO hopeless, but I think that might just be because I dont' have a lot of time in the game yet to learn all of the different things I can do to prolong my survival.   

Discovering the larger chunks of derelict ships as they float by and exploring them is one of my favorite parts of the game.  Upgrading and repairing systems in your own destroyed ship is a lot of fun.   I can't wait to see where this game goes in the future!

39027963.review: This game is alot of FUN and works very well in VR. I really hope the devs keep up the good work, it has a ton of potential!

38957294.review: I love this game because it's a well polished vr survival game in space.  But one thing I would like to be added is your inventory saves and your portable inventory and your upgrades because they don't save when you quit.
